intro: Hieracium goskavarrense, commonly known as the Goskavarren hawkweed, is a species of flowering plant in the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its yellowish-orange composite flowers and hairy, serrated leaves. Native to the mountainous regions of the Iberian Peninsula, it thrives in rocky and grassy habitats. The plant typically grows to a height of 10–30 cm and has a creeping growth habit. Its botanical features make it an important species for studying alpine flora and ecological adaptation.
